title: Beautiful Problem
statementHtml:
For an array aa of length nn and three integers xx, ll, and rr（1≤l≤r≤n1≤l≤r≤n), define:

f(a,x,l,r)={0,if(x−minrj=l(aj))⋅(x−maxrj=l(aj)))<01,if(x−minrj=l(aj))⋅(x−maxrj=l(aj)))≥0

f(a,x,l,r)={0,1,ifif(x−minrj=l(aj))⋅(x−maxrj=l(aj)))<0(x−minrj=l(aj))⋅(x−maxrj=l(aj)))≥0

You are given an array aa of length nn (1≤ai≤n1≤ai≤n), and mm intervals [li,ri][li,ri] (1≤li≤ri≤n1≤li≤ri≤n).

For each x=1,2,…,nx=1,2,…,n, answer the following question independently:
inputSpecHtml:
The first line contains a single integer tt (1≤t≤2⋅1041≤t≤2⋅104) — the number of test cases. Description of each testcase follows.

The first line contains two integers nn and mm (2≤n≤20002≤n≤2000, 1≤m≤20001≤m≤2000).

The next line contains nn space-separated integers a1,a2,⋯,ana1,a2,⋯,an (1≤ai≤n1≤ai≤n).

The next mm lines each contain two space-separated integers li,rili,ri (1≤li≤ri≤n1≤li≤ri≤n), each denoting an interval.

It is guaranteed that the sum of n2n2 and the sum of m2m2 over all test cases does not exceed 4⋅1064⋅106, respectively.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, output a binary string ss. For x=1,2,…,nx=1,2,…,n, sx=1sx=1 only if there exists a rearrangement a′a′ of aa, such that for all 1≤i≤m1≤i≤m, f(a′,x,li,ri)=1f(a′,x,li,ri)=1. Otherwise, sx=0sx=0.
noteHtml:
In the first test case,

  • For x=1x=1, one valid rearrangement is a′=[1,1,3,4]a′=[1,1,3,4].
  • For x=2x=2, there is no rearrangement a′a′ of aa satisfying f(a′,2,1,2)=f(a′,2,2,4)=1f(a′,2,1,2)=f(a′,2,2,4)=1.
  • For x=3x=3, the only valid rearrangement is a′=[4,3,1,1]a′=[4,3,1,1].
  • For x=4x=4, one valid rearrangement is a′=[1,1,3,4]a′=[1,1,3,4].
